alert.note: Alert for Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 11:55AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washington and northwestern Bennington Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1155 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cambridge, or near Salem, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads and in urban and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Salem, Manchester, Cambridge, Manchester Center, Sunderland, Sandgate, Shushan, Beartown, Chiselville, Kansas, Manchester Depot, Richville, Rexleigh, Barnumville, East Arlington, West Sandgate, Eagleville, Anaquassacook and Greenwich Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
